metadata.title: CVE-2021-30485 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in libezxml.a in ezXML 0.8.6. The functionezxml_internal_dtd(), while parsing a crafted XML file, performs incorrectmemory handling, leading to a NULL pointer dereference while runningstrcmp() on a NULL pointer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30485` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

scilab - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
scilab-cli - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
scilab-data - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
scilab-full-bin - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
scilab-include - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
scilab-minimal-bin - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
scilab-test - 5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mapcache package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
scilab package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.2-2ubuntu3+esm1').
netcdf package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
navit package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
